DataElement.preferredName: Patient Adverse Event Grade 3 Or High Bilirubin Period During Reporting Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response to a question that asks whether patient experienced Grade 3 or higher bilirubin blood levels during current reporting period.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Adverse Event Grade 3 Or High Bilirubin Period During Reporting
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A morphologic qualifier indicating that a cancerous lesion is poorly differentiated._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount._A bile pigment that is a degradation product of HEME._An interval of time._At some point in a given period of time._The act of providing a short account.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Adverse Event Grade 3 Or High Bilirubin During Reporting Period
Property.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A morphologic qualifier indicating that a cancerous lesion is poorly differentiated.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.:A bile pigment that is a degradation product of HEME.:At some point in a given period of time.:The act of providing a short account.:An interval of time.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A morphologic qualifier indicating that a cancerous lesion is poorly differentiated.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.
A dark orange, yellow pigment that is the product of the breakdown of iron in the blood; it is conjugated in the liver and excreted in the bile.
At some point in a given period of time.
The act of providing a short account.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
